explanations.summary: Caloric equivalence of O2 for mixed diet is ~20.2 kJ/L (or ~4.83 kcal/L). Pure carbs=21kJ/L, fat=19.6kJ/L, protein=18.8kJ/L. Mixed diet averages ~20 kJ/L.

whyCorrect.e: 20.2 kJ/L is the caloric equivalence of oxygen for a typical mixed diet (RQ ~0.82). This allows indirect calorimetry to calculate energy expenditure from O2 consumption.

whyIncorrect.d: 40 kcal/L is way too high - normal is ~5 kcal/L.

explanations.summary: Metabolic rate = total energy expenditure per unit time = heat production + external work. None of the given options correctly define it.

whyCorrect.e: None of the above is correct. Metabolic rate = Heat produced + External work performed. Options a-d either miss components or incorrectly include storage.

whyIncorrect.a: Storage alone is not metabolic rate.
whyIncorrect.c: Energy output is vague; should be heat + work.

explanations.summary: Measuring BMR via O2 consumption is INDIRECT calorimetry. Direct calorimetry measures actual heat produced. Spirometry measures lung volumes, not metabolism.

whyCorrect.a: Indirect calorimetry measures O2 consumption (and often CO2 production) to calculate metabolic rate using caloric equivalence of oxygen.

whyIncorrect.b: Plethysmograph measures body/lung volumes, not metabolism.
whyIncorrect.c: Spirometry measures lung volumes and airflow, not metabolic rate.
whyIncorrect.d: Oximetry measures blood O2 saturation, not consumption.
